Description: Carlos Mendes (carlos.m@webflowcraft.com) is a full-stack JavaScript engineer working remotely from Porto, Portugal. 
With 7+ years of experience, Carlos builds SaaS platforms and high-performance web apps for startups across the US and Europe. 
He specializes in React, Node.js, Next.js, and PostgreSQL, and is a contributor to the React Hook Form library. 
Carlos has delivered end-to-end apps for clients in healthtech, edtech, and travel â€” including a real-time collaboration platform for a YC-backed company. 
Before freelancing full-time, he worked at OutSystems as a frontend lead. 
Carlos is deeply interested in developer experience (DX), micro frontends, and performance optimization. 
He also teaches advanced TypeScript workshops and runs a YouTube channel focused on debugging and testing patterns.
Name: Carlos Mendes
Email: carlos.m@webflowcraft.com
Role: full-stack JavaScript engineer
Location: Porto, Portugal
Skills: React, Node.js, Next.js, PostgreSQL
Previous Companies: OutSystems
Interests: developer experience (DX), micro frontends, performance optimization
Experience: 7+ years of experience building SaaS platforms and high-performance web apps for startups across the US and Europe

metadata.name: Carlos Mendes
metadata.experience: 7+ years of experience building SaaS platforms and high-performance web apps for startups across the US and Europe

with Kubernetes, Python, and cloud infrastructure. Formerly worked
at Google and loves open-source.

Description: Michael Anderson (michael.anderson@cloudops.io) is a senior DevOps engineer currently living in Austin, Texas. 
He has over 10 years of experience in CI/CD, cloud infrastructure, and automation, and is certified in both AWS and GCP. 
Michael began his career as a systems administrator at IBM, then transitioned to a cloud architect role at Netflix. 
At his current role at CloudOps, he leads infrastructure-as-code initiatives using Terraform and Kubernetes, and has reduced deployment times by 40%. 
His technical toolkit includes Docker, Jenkins, Helm, Prometheus, and Bash scripting. 
In his free time, Michael contributes to open-source monitoring tools and enjoys mentoring junior engineers through TechBridge.
Name: Michael Anderson
Email: michael.anderson@cloudops.io
Role: Senior DevOps Engineer
Location: Austin, Texas
Skills: CI/CD, cloud infrastructure, automation, AWS, GCP, Terraform, Kubernetes, Docker, Jenkins, Helm, Prometheus, Bash scripting
Previous Companies: IBM, Netflix
Interests: open-source monitoring tools, mentoring junior engineers
Experience: Over 10 years of experience in CI/CD, cloud infrastructure, and automation. Leads infrastructure-as-code initiatives using Terraform and Kubernetes at CloudOps, reducing deployment times by 40%.

metadata.name: Michael Anderson
metadata.experience: Over 10 years of experience in CI/CD, cloud infrastructure, and automation. Leads infrastructure-as-code initiatives using Terraform and Kubernetes at CloudOps, reducing deployment times by 40%.

document.pageContent:
Description: Meet Dr. Kunal Sharma (k.sharma@ai.research.org), a Berlin-based data scientist focusing on machine learning for healthcare.
Kunal has a PhD in AI from ETH Zurich and previously contributed to research teams at DeepMind and Novartis. 
His key skills include Python, PyTorch, NLP, and biomedical data modeling. 
In his free time, Kunal enjoys long hikes, jazz piano, and open science advocacy.
Name: Dr. Kunal Sharma
Email: k.sharma@ai.research.org
Role: data scientist
Location: Berlin
Skills: Python, PyTorch, NLP, biomedical data modeling
Previous Companies: DeepMind, Novartis
Interests: long hikes, jazz piano, open science advocacy
Experience: focusing on machine learning for healthcare

metadata.name: Dr. Kunal Sharma
metadata.experience: focusing on machine learning for healthcare

document.pageContent:
Description: Dr. Elena Petrova (elena.petrova@neuralx.ai) is an AI research scientist based in Zurich, Switzerland. 
She holds a Ph.D. in Machine Learning from ETH Zurich, where her dissertation focused on transformer interpretability and multilingual embeddings. 
Elena has published papers at NeurIPS and ICML and is currently leading a research group at NeuralX AI Labs, where she focuses on foundation models, federated learning, and low-resource language models. 
She has collaborated with Hugging Face and DeepMind on multilingual benchmark development. 
Elena's skills include PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformers, TensorFlow, and fastai. 
She speaks five languages fluently, mentors early-career female researchers, and is an advocate for open science and ethical AI.
Name: Dr. Elena Petrova
Email: elena.petrova@neuralx.ai
Role: AI research scientist
Location: Zurich, Switzerland
Skills: PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformers, TensorFlow, fastai
Previous Companies: Hugging Face, DeepMind
Interests: foundation models, federated learning, low-resource language models, open science, ethical AI
Experience: Elena has published papers at NeurIPS and ICML and is currently leading a research group at NeuralX AI Labs.

metadata.name: Dr. Elena Petrova
metadata.experience: Elena has published papers at NeurIPS and ICML and is currently leading a research group at NeuralX AI Labs.
